Mum looked at the point and said 'That's a very nice point'. Then she asked Sam 'What can we do with it?'. Sam thought for a moment and then said 'Let's play a game!'
Mum smiled and said 'What can we do with it?'. Sam pointed to the garden and said 'Let's hide it!'. They went outside and Sam hid the green point under the flower bed. Then he shouted 'It's gone!'.
Mum smiled and said 'Let's play a game. I will hide and you have to find the point'. They took turns hiding and finding the point until Sam found it in a tall tree. 'I see it!', he shouted.
They played with the green point until it was time to go home. Sam said goodbye to the point and took it back inside. He put it away in a safe place and smiled to himself. He would play with the point again soon.

Once upon a time there was a river that flowed through the land. Source of life, the river was special for all the creatures that called it home.
Each day, the sun would shine bright, and the river glittered like diamonds in the summer sky. But one day the sun shone so much that the river water became shallow. All the little fish, turtles and frogs that lived in it could no longer stay in it because their homes were freshly exposed!
The animals were very scared and did not know what to do. That’s when they saw a big sea turtle, much bigger than any of them, walking on the river’s sandy bottom. The big turtle called out to them: “Children, don’t worry. Follow me in a row and I will show you the way to a deep part of the river.”
The animals did as they were told and the big turtle lead them to a much deeper part of the river where they could all find shelter and safety. 
The moral of this story is that we should help others when they need our help, just like the big turtle did for the animals. We should never forget to shine our light onto others to help them along their journey.

Once there was a little bird who wanted to soar like the other birds in the sky. But try as he did, he couldn't get off the ground. He was determined to soar, and he kept trying each day.
One morning the little bird was feeling very brave, so he decided to try one last time. He flapped his wings and jumped up, higher and higher than he ever had before. He felt dizzy as he went higher and higher until finally, he was soaring!
But when he looked down, he saw that he was soaring right over the bathroom! He got so scared and started to flap his wings in the hopes of getting away. But try as he might, he couldn't seem to fly away. He felt stuck in one spot, with all the people below pointing and laughing at him.
The little bird was so embarrassed, he wanted to take a dive and crash, but then he remembered how hard he tried to soar. So he mustered all his courage and managed to keep flying around for a while. He got away from the bathroom eventually and soared off into the sky.
The little bird was so proud of himself for overcoming the conflict and rising above it. He was flying high, and he finally felt like he was part of the sky.

Once there was a little girl named Lucy. She was three years old, and she loved to explore. One day, Lucy and her mom went to the beach.
At the beach, they saw a big boat. Lucy wanted to go on the boat, but her mom said no. Lucy began to cry out of frustration. Her mom felt so bad and hugged her daughter.
The mom then had a thoughtful idea. She knew there was another boat in the harbour, so she suggested they go and show it to Lucy. After a few minutes of walking, the mom and Lucy reached the harbour.
The boat was amazing! It was much smaller and Lucy could explore it without her mom's help. She was so excited and thanked her mom for the thoughtful suggestion. Lucy thought it was the best day ever!
<|endoftext|>

Molly was a little girl who loved to run in her red shoes. She often ran around in circles and made silly noises. One day, when Molly was running around, she stepped wrong and hurt her heel. She started to cry and screamed loudly. 
Molly's mommy came running and scooped her up in her arms. She found a bandage to wrap around Molly's heel and made her a promise that she would buy her new red shoes. 
Molly was happy and excited to get the new shoes. Each time she put them on her mommy made sure to remind her to be careful. Molly remembered the reminder and took care to prevent stepping wrong with her new shoes. 
From then, on Molly was careful while she ran around, always mindful of her heel. Even though she ran as fast as she could, she was careful not to hurt her heel again. 
The end.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time there was a wealthy man. He had a big house and lots of toys. But he was not happy. Every day he would sit in his house and feel sad.
One day, he decided to go for a walk. He started to climb a hill. The sun was shining and the birds were singing. The man began to smile.
As he climbed higher and higher, he got to a special spot at the top of the hill. There he sat down and hummed a song. The more he sang, the happier he felt.
The wealthy man climbed down the hill with a big smile on his face. He had never felt so happy! He thanked the birds for their lovely song. From that day on, the wealthy man was much happier.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time, there was a fat pet. His name was Mark. Every day, Mark enjoyed running around in the garden. 
One day, Mark was feeling particularly adventurous. He decided to explore further into the garden than usual. As he did so, he came across a tasty morsel of food. He quickly gobbled it up! 
Suddenly, Mark heard a voice. It belonged to an old man living in a nearby cottage. He said, "Hey Mark, why don't you come over for a visit?" 
Mark was a bit scared, so he ran away. But the old man called out to him, "It's okay! Come back! I promise I won't bite." 
This made Mark stop. He slowly walked back to the cottage and went inside. The old man had a lot of stories to tell, and soon Mark was smiling and having a great time. 
At the end of the day, the old man waved goodbye to Mark and said, "Come and visit me again, my fat pet!"
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time there was a lonely volcano. He lived up on a high hill in the middle of a vast, deserted valley. Every night, he would sit on the hilltop and look out into the dark, empty landscape.
The volcano felt terribly lonely and wanted some company. One night, he found a voice. It was arguing with itself. When the volcano asked who was talking, the voice replied that it was only a small bird.
The bird had been flying around all night looking for a place to rest. But the volcano made too much noise so the bird kept on flying. The volcano felt sorry for the bird and invited it to stay with him on the hilltop.
The bird accepted, and the two of them talked until the sun began to rise. The bird told the volcano stories of its travels and the volcano listened. Every night when the sun went down, the volcano and the bird would talk until morning came. 
Then one night, instead of talking, the bird started to complain about how cold and lonely it was up on the hilltop. The volcano felt terrible. He was so sorry to hear the bird complain and wanted to make things better. 
The volcano said to the bird that it could come and stay in the big hollow beneath his peak. The bird accepted, and from then on, the volcano and the bird were friends. The lonely volcano had a companion and was never alone again. 
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Jenny who loved spending time outside. One day Jenny found a boat by the river and couldn't wait to explore. She said excitedly "I'm going in the boat."
As she jumped inside and grabbed the oars, her dad said, "Be careful Jenny, and enjoy your journey!" 
Jenny began to row and soon the river started to move with her. She felt the breeze on her face and the sun on her skin. She was so excited that she rowed until the river seemed to be standing still.
Suddenly Jenny heard an owl call out. It was so lazy and relaxing, just like the boat, that Jenny stopped rowing and lay down in the boat. The river moved slowly and Jenny watched the clouds and the birds flying above. She felt so happy and content. As she lay there, she enjoyed the calmness, like she was in a dream.
At sunset, Jenny's dad found her still lying in the boat, smiling away. He said, "Have you enjoyed your journey? Come on, little one, let's go home now." 
Jenny nodded, feeling tired but happy. She smiled as the boat slowly moved back towards the shore.
<|endoftext|>
John loved to play in the pond. Every day he splashed around, feeling the cool water and smiling at all the fish he could see. John saw the shadow of a big bird fly past and he knew something special was about to happen.
He started to swim deeper into the pond and when he looked up, he saw a dragon! John was so scared he forgot how to swim and he started to sink. The dragon came closer and closer and John was too scared to move.
The dragon took one last deep breath and breathed fire over John. He screamed, but it was too late. Everything went dark and the dragon flew away.
The other children had seen what had happened and they were all in shock. Nothing like this had ever happened before, it was definitely not normal. The pond was quiet and dark now and nobody felt like splashing around anymore.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who loved hunting for treasures in the woods. One day she found a shiny copper coin and was so excited! She couldn’t wait to show it to her mother.
At supper that night, the little girl showed her mother the copper coin. “Look what I found!” she said.
Her mother smiled. “That’s lovely! Are you sure you don’t want to keep it?”
The little girl thought for a moment. “No, I will return it to where I found it.”
The next morning the little girl put the coin back in the woods. As she picked it up she noticed a spicy smell, like cooking food.
Suddenly, a voice called out from a nearby bush. “Thank you for returning my coin! You are a kind and honest person.”
The little girl was surprised. Who was talking to her?
As she stepped closer to the bush, she noticed a creature with big eyes and furry ears. He held a spoonful of spicy soup and said, “Here, this is a small thank you for returning my coin.”
The moral of the story is that being kind and honest is always rewarded in the end.

Molly was very excited about the new rubber. It was pink and delightful. She could not wait to explore it.
She ran to the garden with her rubber. She was determined to improve her hopscotch game. She drew a line in the grass and laid out the rubber pieces in a row. With each piece Molly hopped further. She was so excited to see how far she could go.
When it was time for snack, Molly decided to try something new - delicious grapes. She had never eaten grapes before, but this time she decided to give them a taste. The grapes were so juicy and sweet. Molly loved them and asked for more. 
Molly was very proud of herself; she had improved her hopscotch game and tried something new that day. She felt very fulfilled.

Once there was a little girl. She was so glad to see her new toy. It was a bright pink top that she could spin. She tried to spin it as fast as she could. She was so happy.
But then, the top spun off the table and it broke. She was sad and no longer glad. Her toy was all broken and she could not spin it anymore.
The little girl was so sad that she started to cry. She could not believe that her toy was gone and that she could no longer spin it. 
The little girl tried to fix her toy. But no matter what she did, it stayed broken. She was so sad that she never wanted to try spinning again.

John was a curious boy. He had a guitar and he spent a lot of time rubbing it. One day, John wanted to take his guitar outside to show it off, but his mom said no. He was very sad, but still curious.
John's Dad had an idea. He said if John polished the guitar, it might make it look nicer. John liked the idea and started rubbing it with a soft cloth. He rubbed and rubbed until the guitar shined.
When he was done, his Dad asked him to play his guitar. John was so excited! He started strumming and soon the whole house was filled with music. Everyone was smiling.
John was so happy and he knew his guitar looked nice too. He was curious to see what other people thought of it. So he took it to the park to show it off. Everyone was amazed by John's guitar and he was so proud. The whole day, they admired it and asked questions.
John realized that sometimes, things don't work out the way you expect them to. But if you are curious and work hard, then you can make something beautiful.

Once there was a big birdcage. Inside the birdcage was a little bird. He wanted to fly, but he couldn't since the birdcage was too big. So he decided to look for a way out.
The little bird tried to use his beak to peck through the bars, but it didn't work. Then he tried to use his wings to pull the bars apart, but they were too strong.
The bird thought and thought, until he finally came up with an idea. He got some tiny pieces of string and tied them together. Then he used them to try and open the door of the birdcage.
Finally, the door opened and the little bird was able to fly away. He was so happy! He had defeated the big birdcage and was now free.

Once upon a time, there was a curious little girl named Anna. She loved exploring and learning about the world around her.
One day, Anna was playing with her marbles when she heard a noise coming from the garden. Curious, she went outside to take a peek.
To her surprise, she saw a little animal! It was a squirrel looking right at her and she was not sure what it was. Anna wanted to know more so she asked it "Who are you?". 
The squirrel looked at her and replied "I am a squirrel and I live in the garden". Anna was excited to learn something new and asked another question, "What is your name?".
The squirrel replied, "My name is Daisy. Would you like to play with me and my marbles?". Anna smiled and said "Yes!", so they spent the day having fun playing with the marbles.
In the end, Anna was happy to have a new friend. She learned a lot from Daisy, and will always remember her curious adventure in the garden.

Once upon a time, there were two friends called Sam and Jane. Sam was three years old and Jane was six years old. Sam and Jane enjoyed playing together in the garden. One day, they were playing and they noticed that nearby was a witch.
The witch was very messy, wearing many different coloured scarfs and had a pointed hat. Sam and Jane were a bit scared but the witch said, “Don’t worry! I promise that I will not do any magic on you!”
The witch smiled and waved goodbye as she flew away. Sam and Jane hugged each other and ran back inside. They were very happy that the witch had kept her promise! From then on, Sam and Jane always looked for the witch in the garden.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Kate. Kate was very healthy and liked to go for long rides in her mom's automobile. She was so excited to get in the car and put her seatbelt on so she could go on an adventure. Every time she went for a ride, she liked to name the car, and each name was something silly and fun. Today she named the automobile "Turbo Speed Racer". She had the best time in her mom's car and loved feeling the wind in her hair. When the ride was over, Kate was happy and felt so healthy. She couldn't wait to go for another ride in her turbo speed racer soon!

Once upon a time, there was a little bird called Chirpy. Chirpy loved to whistle happily. One day Chirpy was flying through the forest when he noticed a bright red jacket on the ground. He stopped to take a closer look. 
Chirpy admired the jacket, it was so impressive! He wanted to try it on so he hopped up onto the jacket and began to whistle a happy tune. As he danced around, he heard a voice:
"What a wonderful coat you have! I wish I had a coat like yours!" said a little mouse standing nearby.
Chirpy was so surprised he stopped whistling. The little mouse had nothing to wear.
The moral of the story is that it is important to be grateful for what you have. We should never compare ourselves with others, as we never truly know what they are experiencing.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Kim. One day, Kim was very bored and wanted to talk to someone. However, everyone was busy and did not have time to talk.
Kim then spotted a knife on the ground. She was curious so she picked it up and asked the knife, "Hi Knife! Do you want to talk to me?"
The knife was silent and didn't answer her. Kim was feeling very sad and lonely. She started to cry and said, "It's so boring talking to myself."
Suddenly, the knife spoke up and said, "Don't cry Kim. I'm here to talk to you!" Kim was very surprised and excited to hear the knife talk.
Kim and the knife were the best of friends and she wasn't bored anymore. From then on, Kim and the knife talked to each other all the time.

Once upon a time, there was a boy and a girl. They loved to play together outside. One day, the girl wanted to go and play hide and seek. 
The boy said, “Let’s play. But put on your sunglasses first!”
The girl was careless, so she said, “No, I don’t need them. I’ll be fine without them.” 
The boy said, “I hope you will be careful. Sunglasses help protect your eyes.” 
The girl said, “Okay, I will put them on.” 
So, the boy and girl went outside to play. They were having lots of fun. But, one time the girl wasn’t being very careful and she almost got hurt. 
The boy said, “I told you to put on your sunglasses. They would have helped you stay safe.” 
The girl said, “You are right! From now on, I will be more careful and put on my sunglasses.” 
The moral of this story is to be careful and always wear your sunglasses when playing outside. Hope your eyes stay safe!

Mama had a big surprise for Baby. She put a big bubble in the middle of the floor and said “Now, Baby, crawl through this bubble!” Baby was excited and got on her hands and knees, pushing the bubble with her nose. She crawled inside the bubble and felt it bouncing against her. Suddenly, it popped and Baby was surrounded by bubbles.
Baby thought the bubbles were so much fun. She reached over to grab one, but it popped right in her hand. Baby got a bit sad, but noticed something disgusting on the floor. It was a big, slimy slug! She screamed.
Mama said, “Don't worry, Baby - it's just a slug. See, it's crawling away now.” Baby looked up and sure enough, the slimy slug was slowly sliding away. Baby smiled and decided to forget the nasty creature. She turned back to the bubbles and happily jumped in the middle of them.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mary. Mary loved to march. Every day she marched around the playground, and sang happy songs. One day, Mary laughed too loudly, and made a lot of noise.
A grumpy old man heard the noise and became very angry. He shouted at Mary to stop, but she just laughed harder. The angry old man marched up to Mary and told her to be quiet. Mary was scared and stopped laughing.
The old man continued to march around Mary, getting closer and closer. He said nasty things to her and made her feel hurt. Finally, he got so close that he pushed her over. Mary cried and ran away.
The moral of the story is that it is important to be respectful of others, no matter how different they are. Everyone has a right to laugh and be happy, but always with respect and kindness.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy called John who had a bedroom of his own. It was always so calm in his bedroom and he loved to play when he was in there. 
One day, John was playing with his toys when he noticed a piece of rope on the ground. He was so curious and he decided to pick it up. He started to twist it around his hands, pretending it was a snake. He said, "Hissssss!".
Suddenly, he heard a loud laugh and he looked up to see his mom leaning against the bedroom door, watching him. She said, "You look like you're having so much fun with that rope!" John beamed and said "Yeah, it's so much fun!" 
John's mom came over and knelt down next to him. She picked up the rope and showed John how to twist it even tighter. Then she said, "It's time for dinner - why don't you put the rope away for now and let's go downstairs?" 
John put the rope away, feeling so excited to show his dad what he had learnt. Together, he and his mom went downstairs with a calm smile on both their faces.

Once upon a time, there was a sweet little girl. She ran around her house and laughed in the sun. One day, she saw something special. She saw a big, yummy cake! It was gray with lots of sprinkles and decorations.
The little girl smiled and said, "Oh wow! Cake! I want to eat it."
But then, she heard a loud scream. It was coming from her mommy. Her mommy said, "No! Don't touch the cake!"
The little girl was scared. She started to cry. But then she heard her mommy's voice again. "It's okay sweetheart. You can have the cake after dinner."
The little girl was so happy. She hugged her mommy and laughed. And when dinner was done, she had a very big slice of the gray cake. It was the yummiest cake she ever ate!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Penny. Penny was three years old and she was always very curious. Today, she decided to explore in her mum's room. 
Penny found a piece of paper and it looked very fascinating to her. She carefully picked it up and wanted to fit it in her tiny pocket. But it was too big and it wouldn't fit.
Penny started to get sad and she said "I want to keep it! Its very tasty!" Her Mum heard her and came into the room. She said "Its alright, Penny. You can keep it!"
Penny was so excited and she thanked her Mum. With the help of her Mum, she managed to fold the paper and it fit nicely into her pocket. She happily skipped out of the room, still holding her piece of tasty paper.

Once upon a time, there was a wet dog. He was very dirty, and he was all alone. He was so sad and he didn't know what to do.
Then one day, a nice lady came and saw the wet, dirty dog. She said to him "You need a bath, don't you?". The dog nodded and followed the lady.
The nice lady brought the dog to her house, and showed him two big buckets. One was filled with wet water and the other was empty. She said "Jump in the wet water and I will help you to wash and be clean". The happy dog jumped in the water and the lady started to serve him. She washed him with the wet water, and after that, the poor dog was all clean and dry.
The wet, dirty dog was now happy and clean. The nice lady had served him and made him better. They both smiled as the lady's kindness had made the dog happy. And they both lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time there was a brave cat called Lucy. She had the most beautiful fur.
Every day Lucy's owner gave her some food to eat. Lucy loved her food and licked her lips in delight.
One day, Lucy saw a shock outside in the garden and she wanted to explore it. She was the bravest cat around; so she thought nothing of walking up to the shock.
But as she got closer, she saw a huge noisy machine. She jumped back and was so scared, her tail was shaking!
But then she heard a voice calling out. "Don't be afraid Lucy. It's ok, I'm here to feed you."
It was Lucy's owner and he was smiling. He reached out and stroked her head and told her to be brave.
He fed her until she was full and gave her a hug. Then he said,"Come on Lucy, let's go home."
And so Lucy and her owner went home, safe and sound. Lucy the brave cat knew that if she was ever in danger, her owner would always be there to protect her. 
The end.

Once upon a time there was a powerful man named Bob. He had a special pass that was very important. He kept it in a safe place and didn't tell anyone about it.
One day, Bob met a small child who said he wanted to help. Bob didn't know what to do, but he trusted the little one. So he gave the pass to the child. 
The little boy thanked Bob and ran off. Bob watched him go, feeling very worried about his pass. 
The next day, the little boy came back with the pass. Amazingly, he had kept it safe! Bob was so glad. He thanked the little boy and knew he had made the right decision to trust him.

He thanked God for showing him this new, strange thing. From then on he continued to study new things every day. One morning, Jenny got up and went outside to the garden. She found a pretty rock and picked it up. She said to herself, "I'm not going to forget this pretty rock."
She brought it with her back inside and put it on a shelf. Later in the day, Jenny was busy playing with her toys. Then suddenly she remembered the rock. She asked her mom, "Mommy, did I forget something today?"
Mommy looked at her carefully and said, "No, I don't think so. What did you think you forgot?"
Jenny said, "I found a pretty rock this morning but I don't remember where I put it!"
Mommy smiled and said, "Oh, the rock. I put it on the shelf for you. You can go get it anytime you want."
Jenny smiled and ran off to get the rock. She looked at it and said, "Thanks, Mommy! I won't forget this pretty rock again!"

Once upon a time there were two friends, Sally and Daisy. They were both very organized and liked to keep their things neat and tidy. 
One day, Sally found a round ice cube in her garden. She wanted to keep it so she set off to find Daisy to show her. 
But when Sally arrived, Daisy was not happy. She said it was not organized, and that Sally had to put the round ice cube back in the garden. Sally did not want to, so she put the ice cube in her pocket and ran away.
Sally kept the round ice cube hidden for a few days until one sunny day when the ice cube started to melt. The round ice cube became a big, wet mess in Sally's pocket. 
Sally was sad, but Daisy said she could help. She got a bucket to put the melted ice cube in, and they put it back in the garden together.
At the end, Sally and Daisy were still friends and the garden was organized again.

And from then on, the number grew bigger and bigger, spreading fast from one person to another, making lots of happy friends along the way.

Once upon a time, there was a 3 year old boy. He went to a big dark room with a lot of chairs. Everybody had an exam, and the boy was scared.
The teacher said, "Now it's exam time!" All of the children began to serve the exams. But the 3 year old boy didn't know what to do. He started to cry, and he was very scared. 
The teacher said, "You have to serve this exam, just like all of the other children." The 3 year old boy was so scared that he couldn't serve the exam. 
The teacher said, "Well, I'm sorry. You can't stay in this exam if you can't complete it." So the 3 year old boy went home with a sad feeling in his heart. He had failed the dark and scary exam.

Once upon a time, there was a bright duck who liked to zoom around the pond. He made lots of friends when he zoomed around, and everyone in the pond was happy. 
But then one day a big bird came and tried to take the duck away. The duck tried to zoom away but the big bird was too fast. He tried but he couldn’t escape. 
The duck was very scared but he didn’t give up. He tried to think of a plan, but it was too late. The big bird grabbed him with its claws and flew away. 
The other animals in the pond were sad. They missed the bright duck and wished he had been able to zoom away. The bright duck was never seen again. 
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a fat horse. He wanted to play with his friends, but his friends said he was too fat. He felt very sad and wished he could be thin like his friends. 
One day he saw a magical bottle and he picked it up. When he opened it up, water sprayed out of it. He thought it was so fun, he sprayed the water all over himself. 
Suddenly, he was thin! All of his friends were amazed at how thin the fat horse had become. But then, the magical bottle started to spray again, and the fat horse became fat once more! 
The other horses laughed and teased the fat horse, but he was determined to keep his thin figure. So every day he picked up that magical bottle and sprayed himself with the magical water,until he was thin again.

Once there was a little girl who was excited to go to the beach. As she ran onto the sand, she looked out and admired the sparkling blue sea. She saw a big boat on the horizon and she was amazed. She clapped her hands together and smiled with glee. 
The little girl spotted a lady walking along the beach. The lady was carrying a big basket and the little girl wondered what was inside. She skipped up to the lady and asked if she could take a peek. 
The lady grinned and said yes, so the little girl peered inside to find lots of beautiful shells. The lady said each one was unique and special, just like a person's heart. The little girl felt special too and was excited to find the special shell of her own. She looked around and admired the different shells until she found one with a pretty pattern. The little girl hugged it close and said thank you to the lady.
The little girl was excited to have her special shell. As she walked home along the beach, she kept admiring and admiring her precious shell and feeling the specialness in her heart.

Once upon a time, there was a gray bird who loved to sing. Every morning, the bird twittered and sang the happiest songs that it could find. 
One day, the bird flew over a lady's garden and saw something very special- a ripe avocado! The bird swooped down and grabbed the avocado in it's beak. 
The bird decided to fly high into the sky and find a nice spot to enjoy its snack. As it flew higher and higher, the bird sang a happy song while munching on its prize. 
The bird continued to sing even after the avocado was gone, until finally the sun began to set and the bird flew home. 
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a tough butterfly that lived in the garden. Every day, the butterfly would fly around and explore. But one day, the butterfly came across something it didn't understand.
It saw a big tall branch, covered in what looked like little hiding places. It was so curious, the butterfly decided to investigate.
When the butterfly looked closer, it realised the little hiding places were full of seed! But the butterfly couldn't reach the seed. No matter how hard it tried, it just couldn't get to the top of the branch.
Suddenly, it heard something, a deep and gentle voice. "Little butterfly, why don't you rest for a moment?" the voice said.
The butterfly looked around and discovered that the voice had come from a kind little bird.
The bird smiled and said "If you let me serve you, little butterfly, I could help you get the seed."
The butterfly thought long and hard, and decided to trust the bird. The bird served the butterfly by pushing her up toward the top of the branch.
The butterfly was so happy - she was able to get the seed. She thanked the bird for serving her, and promised to do the same if the bird ever needed help.
This story has a moral value - if you are in need, don't be afraid to ask for help. Sometimes, helping others can be more rewarding than it seems at

John woke up and opened his eyes. He looked around his bedroom. John's bedroom had a big bed and a toy sack on the floor. He grabbed the sack and opened it. Inside he found lots of fun toys. He was excited!
John was about to play when he heard someone knocking at the door. It was his grandmother. John was so excited. "Welcome grandmother!" he said. 
Grandmother walked in with a big smile. She had a big sack in her hands. "I brought you a surprise," said Grandmother. John opened the sack and saw lots of candy inside. He was so happy! 
John said 'thank you' to his grandmother and ate the candy. After he ate them, he felt a little bit ashamed. He had eaten all the candy without sharing. 
Grandmother smiled. She said, "It's okay to feel ashamed. But then you can say sorry, and be more generous next time." John hugged his grandmother and said, "I'm sorry and I'll share next time!" Grandmother nodded with a smile.

It was a mosquito! She had never seen one before and she was excited. She reached out her hand to touch it. The mosquito was very kind and stayed still. The girl was happy to have made a new friend. She thanked the mosquito, and continued her walk. She had discovered something new, and it made her feel very happy.

Billy had been looking for adventure all day. He had searched around the house, up in the trees, and even in the garden! But nothing exciting had happened.
Billy decided to go for a walk. He slowly made his way through the field, feeling the grass beneath his feet.
Suddenly, Billy stumbled and fell! He tried to get back up, but he felt clumsy and embarrassed. Billy couldn't help but feel sad. "Oh no!" He said.
Just then, a friendly little rabbit hopped up to Billy. The rabbit's soft fur was so inviting and it smiled at Billy.
Billy smiled back. He felt much better and back to his old self. He knew that the adventure he was searching for was right in front of him.
The two of them looked at each other, not knowing what the next step was. Then the little rabbit shrugged, as if to say "shall we continue on this adventure?". Billy nodded and the two of them set off into the field.

Peter was excited. Today he was going to play with water. He ran to the backyard and saw a delicate little pond filled with water. He reached out and touched it with his tiny hands. The water was cold and wet.
He smiled and asked his mom, "Can I play with the water?"
"Yes, but be careful. Water is delicate and you need to be gentle," his mom replied.
So Peter got on his hands and knees and began to touch the water. He felt the cold droplets on his fingers. Then he started to splash the water and laughed with joy.
He continued to touch the water and soon he was playing a game where he had to find the pebbles hidden underneath the surface. Peter was having a lot of fun.
He continued to play in the water until it was time to go inside. He felt a bit sad to leave but he promised himself that he would come back tomorrow.

Once upon a time there was a patient bear. Every day he would go out and trade with all the animals in the woods. One day he was going to meet a rabbit for a trade, but as he walked he slipped on a stone. He was careful for the rest of the way, but deep down he knew that something bad was coming soon. 
When he arrived at the rabbit's house, he was shocked to find out that all his trades had been cancelled. Disappointed, the bear went home. But the next day, he decided to try again. 
This time, he made sure he was extra careful, even though it took him a long time to get to the rabbit's house. When he arrived, he was so pleased to find out that all his trades had been saved! The patient bear was so happy that he decided to slip on a stone to celebrate.

Once upon a time, there were two friends. Their names were Bob and Jill. Bob and Jill were walking down the street when they saw a puppy. It was so cute and charming! They admired the puppy and Bob wanted to pet it.
Bob said to Jill, "Let's stay and play with the puppy!" Jill smiled. They sat down and pet the puppy. It was so soft and fun!
Suddenly, Bob had an idea. He said,"Let's tease the puppy!" Jill thought it was a good idea, so they started to tease the puppy. They made funny noises and tried to get the puppy's attention.
The puppy was so funny! It barked and chased them around the street. They laughed and laughed. They had so much fun teasing the puppy!
When it was time to leave, Bob said, "Let's come back and tease the puppy again. It's so charming!" 
Jill agreed and they waved goodbye to the puppy. They had a great time.

One warm summer day, a small girl named Charlotte ran out to the backyard with glee. She was so excited for a new adventure that day! She noticed a beautiful palm tree in the center of the backyard and ran towards it.
When she made it to the base of the palms, she saw an ant on the ground inching its way up the trunk at a slow, steady pace. Charlotte watched it for a few moments, and then said, “hello ant! Why are you running so slow?”
The ant looked up at her and said, “I'm running slow because I'm trying to reach the top of this palm tree, and that's a long way to go!”
Charlotte smiled, and she said, “then let's both run together, so you can get there faster!” 
The ant smiled back and said, “that sounds like a great idea!” So, the two of them started running together up the palm tree, faster and faster. Eventually, they made it to the top!
Charlotte and the ant stopped at the top of the palm and looked down. They both smiled and Charlotte said, “thank you for running with me, my little ant friend. That was lots of fun!”
The ant nodded and said, “me too, Charlotte. Until next time!” And with that, they went

The boy started to get scared. He wanted to go back, but the tunnel seemed so long. He was getting wetter and wetter.
Suddenly, he heard a noise. He looked up and saw a light. It was the end of the tunnel! He ran quickly to the end and saw the sun. He was happy that he made it out. 
The boy never went back in the tunnel again.

Once upon a time, there was a brother and a sister named Jack and Jane. They loved each other very much and they were always spending time together.
One day, the siblings were cooking rice in their kitchen. Jack sprinkled some mild spice on his rice and Jane sprinkled a lot of spices on hers.
Jack said to her “Why are you using so much spice, Jane?”
Jane replied “Because I love spicy food!”
Jack smiled and said “I like mild, but I still love you”.
The moral of the story is that we may have different tastes in food but it doesn't change the amount of love we have for each other.

He felt so happy and he used the branch to pull himself up. He climed higher and higher and his heart was beating like thunder. Then he noticed that there were some thick leaves above him. He was very excited and he decided to pull them and see what was underneath. To Jack's surprise, he found a secret nest! He had found the perfect place to stay and keep dry from the rain. It had all been so easy - he only had to pull the leaves and there it was. He was so glad he found it. He stayed at the nest for the whole afternoon, feeling happy and warm. 
When it started to get dark, Jack said goodbye to the nest and went back home. He was so excited to tell his family all about his secret discovery!

Jack smiled and waved goodbye. He felt glad that he was able to help the little ant. Jack was about to walk away when he saw 3 more ants on the ground. They seemed lonely too. Jack started to stare at them, wondering what he could do to help. Then he had an idea.
Jack found some pebbles nearby and built a small pile near the ants. The ants all climbed up the pile and slowly, one by one, they traveled away. Jack smiled and waved goodbye once again. He was so happy. Jack had helped 4 lonely ants and he felt really good.

The princess held the prince's hand and said, "I am marrying you so that I'll never be miserable again."

Once upon a time, there was an old man. He had an old chess set. One day, the old man saw something shiny in the corner of the room. When he went over to take a closer look, he realized that it was a little sparrow.
The old man said, "Hello, little one. What are you doing here?"
The sparrow said, "I was playing with your old chess pieces. I tore one of the pieces in two!"
The old man was surprised. He told the sparrow not to worry, and carefully picked up the two pieces of the chess piece. He looked at the pieces, and smiled.
The old man said, "At least you were having fun! We can put it back together. Here, watch me carefully."
The old man carefully put the two pieces together, and then the piece shone just like new. The old man said to the sparrow, "See, we fixed it! Now, let's play a game of chess together."
The old man and the sparrow played a game of chess, and the old man won every time. When it was time to go, the old man said goodbye to the sparrow and thanked him for the game. The sparrow said, "Thanks for fixing my mistake!" and flew away.

Once upon a time, a little girl was walking up the stairs. She counted them as she walked up, "1, 2, 3... 7, 8, 9!" From the top of the stairs, she could see into a deep, dark room.
The little girl was timid and scared, so she walked back down the stairs. When she reached the bottom, a kind voice spoke out to her, "What's wrong?"
"It's too deep and scary in there," said the little girl.
The kind voice said, "It's all right, I can help you count the stairs to make it feel more safe."
The little girl took a deep breath, nodded, and then counted again, "1, 2, 3... 7, 8, 9!"
Together, the little girl and the kind voice took the steps one number at a time. Finally, when they reached the top, the little girl looked into the deep, dark room. She had conquered her fears and smiled proudly.

Tam was very happy with her new toy and she loved to play with it. She learned a lot of things from it and enjoyed her new playhouse more than she would have enjoyed a new cell phone.

Using Lily’s advice, Grandma mixed some colors together and the dress became more interesting. Grandma was now comfortable wearing the dress.

Once upon a time there lived a poor man and a poor woman. The poor man sold ash every day and gave it to his poor wife to mix with water and make good clay for pots. 
One day, the poor man was so tired from all the work he had done in the field. He said to his wife, "I can't sell anymore ash. I am too tired".
His wife said, "If you don't sell ash, how will we get food for us and the children? You must continue to sell ash, even if you are tired".
The poor man then understood that he must continue to do his job, even if he was tired, so he could provide food for his family. 
Moral of the story: We must work hard and not give up, even if we are tired, so we can get the things we need in life.

He was so close to the strawberry, but a snail was faster and the strawberry was gone! The frog was so sad that he couldn't win the race. He decided that he wanted to try again. So the next day he went back and asked the snail if they could try the race again. The snail said yes. This time, the frog gave it all his energy and hopped as fast as he could. He beat the snail to the strawberry and won the race! The frog was so happy. He enjoyed his strawberry and was proud that he won the race.

Darnell was walking through the park with his mum one day. He was very careful where he stepped and he looked around at all of the things going on. He spotted a chair in the middle of the park and he quickly ran to it and sat down.
Darnell stared at the chair. It was an old, wooden chair with a soft cushion on it. He wondered who might have sat in it before him and why it was left there. He was so curious that he just kept staring at it!
Meanwhile, his mum explained to him why it was important to be patient and careful. She warned him that just as something could be found, it might also be lost. Darnell didn't understand what she meant at first, but he kept staring at the chair, thinking it over.
The next day, Darnell was back in the park. As he walked past the chair, he noticed it was gone. He knew now why his mum had asked him to be careful and he vowed to always remember her advice in the future.

Sally was scared and asked Steve, "What is this place?" Steve told her, "Don't worry, let's just take a peek inside."
The door opened and they heard a sweet noise. It was a singing bird. They stepped in and to their surprise they saw a beautiful garden full of colourful flowers. They spent a few minutes admiring the garden and they heard the bird's song getting louder and louder. Suddenly, something amazing happened; the sky started to turn a gorgeous shade of pink.
The two friends were filled with wonder, and happy that they decided to take this adventure. They watched in awe as the sky slowly turned to a deep blue colour. As the sky turned dark, Sally and Steve stood hand in hand, feeling the sweet joy of friendship.

Charlie ran over to the pond and started splashing in the cool water. He noticed something small and white floating in the pond. He picked it up and saw it was a tiny flea!
He said "Mom, look at this flea!"
His mom said, "Oh, it's so kind of you to look after the flea. Can you put it back in the pond?"
Charlie smiled and put the flea gently back in the pond. As it floated away, Charlie watched it with a happy smile. Then he went running back to the pond and started to soak some more.

The most exciting attraction was the slide - they ran up to it and joined the queue, eagerly awaiting their turn. When the time came, Sarah slid down first - and then it was Billy's turn.
He got to the top of the slide, and couldn't wait to slide down to the bottom. But, when he got to the bottom, Billy started to feel dizzy. He tried to stand up, but he couldn't. Sarah had expected Billy to join her, but he stayed lying on the ground and didn't move.
It was only then when Sarah realised that something was very wrong. Once the teachers and parents arrived, the truth quickly began to unfold: Billy had had a medical emergency, and he had been rushed by ambulance to the hospital.
Unfortunately, when Billy arrived at the hospital he had already passed away. The slide had been the last thing he ever did - it was the activity that had caused his dizzy feeling and the medical emergency that would take his life.

The older brother said, "Let me show you. It can be fun! Here, I'll count with you and make it funny!"

The moral of the story is that it is better to appreciate things from a distance, rather than taking them away. Nature is beautiful and it is important to respect it and care for it.

But Jay shook his head. "No! I'm scared. I'm too little," he said.
Jenna didn't give up. She kept begging Jay to climb the tree. Finally, Jay said, "Okay, I'll try it...but I might get hurt!"
They climbed the tree together. Jenna went up first and held out a hand to help Jay. Jay felt scared, but he trusted Jenna and made it to the top of the tree. They were so happy!
Suddenly, there was a loud crack, and Jenna and Jay fell out of the tree. Jenna was hurt and Jay felt guilty, but she said, "No worries! We still had so much fun together. That's what is important."
Jenna and Jay loved playing together, even if they got hurt sometimes. Friendship is more important than feeling guilty or scared.

As the boat sailed, Tony looked out and saw the bright blue sea. Then, he glanced over and noticed a big rock with something shiny inside. He knew it was an oyster and loaded his boat with it. 
"Wow!" Tony shouted. "I'm gonna open this oyster!"
But, when Tony took out his knife and tried to open the oyster, he realized it was too hard. He tried again and again, but with no success. Tony felt frustrated, but he was determined to open the oyster. 
Finally, Tony thought of a plan. He gathered all of his strength and loaded both his hands against the oyster. With one final push, Tony opened the oyster and found a big pearl inside.
He smiled and said, "I did it!"

Once upon a time there was a lazy boat. Every day it would just float on the water, just doing nothing. Each day some animals around the water would observe the boat and wonder what it was doing.
One day a fox decided he was going to ask the boat why it did nothing all day. He swam up to the boat and asked it why it was so lazy. The boat replied that it was just too tired.
The fox told the boat that it should find something to do, that it should work hard instead of being lazy. He said the more it worked, the better it would feel afterwards. The boat listened to the fox and decided it would try it for one day.
By the end of the day, the boat was feeling much stronger and happier. The fox swam up one last time and asked the boat how it was feeling. The boat happily said it felt much better now that it wasn't so lazy!
The moral of this story is that work brings more happiness than laziness. The moral is that if we work hard, it can make us feel better.

"It's coal," answered his mom.
Sam was very curious. He asked her, "What is this coal for?"
"Well," said his mom, "coal can be used to make lots of things, like energy and heat. It belongs to all of us, so we should use it fairly."
Sam nodded thoughtfully. He understood that coal belonged to the whole world, and it was his responsibility to share it fairly. He smiled and said, "Ok, I will!" 
From then on, Sam made sure to use coal fairly and responsibly.

Once upon a time, there was a very wise old man who lived by himself in the woods. He was very wise and knew many things.
One day, he was walking around his house, looking for something to do. Suddenly, he heard a tap, tap, tap. He followed the noise to the back of his house where he saw a small furry creature with a shovel.
The creature was trying to bury something in the ground. The wise old man asked him, "What are you burying?"
The creature replied, "I'm burying a treasure. I hope it will be safe here."
The old man chuckled. He said, "I'm wise and I can tell you that buried treasures don't bring any luck. You'll be better off keeping it with you."
The creature thanked the old man for his advice and quickly picked up the treasure and headed off into the woods.
The old man was happy and smiled as he watched the little creature boot away. He was glad to have been able to help.

Once there was a naughty bunny who lived in the spring woods. One evening the bunny was hopping around and looking for something to eat. He spotted a carrot and went over to eat it. But when the bunny was about to take a bite, he noticed it was split in two.
The bunny was surprised, so he started to investigate. He saw that a naughty squirrel had taken a bite out of the carrot. The bunny was angry, but he didn't know what to do. He just stared at the squirrel and shook his head.
The squirrel saw the bunny and hopped away. He was so scared he even forgot to grab the carrot. The bunny watched him go and smiled. He knew he had won.
The bunny hopped away, feeling very pleased with himself. He may have been naughty, but sometimes that can be a good thing. He was glad he had split that carrot with the squirrel.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Sarah. She lived in a big house with her mom and dad. Sarah had a special vase that was bright and pretty.
One day, Sarah wanted to make the vase look even prettier. She noticed it had sharp edges, so she grabbed a crayon from the table and started to color them. She made the edges pale pink and pale orange.
After she finished coloring, Sarah ran to the window to look at the vase. She saw that the edges looked so pretty and sharp! She was so proud of her work and couldn’t wait to show it to her mom and dad.
The end.

Once there was a playground with a big swing. Everyone loved to swing on it. One day a hurricane was coming. The swing seemed harmless, so it stayed put while everything else moved around. It stayed strong in the wind and the rain.
After the storm had passed, the swing was still safe. The children were very excited to see the swing was all right. They said, “Let’s swing higher than before!” So they climbed onto the swing and started to fly through the air. The swing went higher and higher and they laughed with joy.
The swing stayed safe during the hurricane and the children had a wonderful time swinging on it.
<|endoftext|>
 
Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Jenna. Jenna was a very obedient girl. She knew that if her mother told her to stay somewhere, she had to stay there until her mother came back. 
One day, Jenna was playing in the backyard. She was spinning around like a top. Jenna's mother saw her and called her over. Jenna was obedient and stopped spinning to listen to her mom. 
Her mother said, "I'm going to the store Jenna. You need to stay here until I come back. Don't wander off. Do you understand?" 
Jenna nodded and said, "Yes, mommy. I will stay." 
So Jenna obeyed her mother and stayed still in the backyard until her mom got back. Spin was fun, but it was more fun to be obedient.

Harry was excited. His best friend was coming over to play. His friend, Tim, brought his scooter. 
"Hi, Tim," Harry said. "Can I borrow your scooter?"
Tim thought for a moment.
"OK," Tim said. He smiled.
Harry grabbed the scooter and ran outside. He had so much fun scooting down the sidewalk.
Suddenly, a man came around the corner. His face was angry.
"Stop right there!" the man said. "That's my scooter!" 
Harry was scared. He hadn't meant to borrow someone else's scooter. 
"I'm sorry," Harry said. He gave the man back the scooter.
The man took the scooter and left.
Harry and Tim went back inside. 
"That was a close call," Tim said.
Harry nodded. He was glad to have his friend by his side. They played together the rest of the day.
<|endoftext|>
Once there was an eye. It was looking around and trying to guess where it should go. It was feeling a bit lost and very alone.
Suddenly, something disgusting floated by. It was smelly and slimy. The eye didn't like it.
The eye decided to move away from it. It started to swim and swim until it found something it liked.
Finally, the eye saw something lovely! It was a beautiful flower and it was shining in the sun. The eye was so happy it wanted to stay there forever.
So that's what the eye did. It stayed by the flower and enjoyed it's lovely home. They were very happy together.

Once upon a time, there was an ugly house in the middle of the woods. One day, all the animals in the woods had a meeting. The animals were worried because they heard that something bad was coming.
So the animals decided to warn the house. They sang a loud song to tell the house about the bad thing coming. But the house didn't listen.
Suddenly, the bad thing arrived. The bad thing was a big storm. It was going to destroy the ugly house.
The animals all kept singing, but the house still didn't move. The storm was getting closer and the animals were scared. Finally, the house started to move. It was running away from the storm.
The animals were so happy and relieved. The storm had passed, and the ugly house was safe. The animals sang and cheered with relief, and the ugly house was saved.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Dee was traveling with her mom. Dee’s mom was carrying a razor and Dee was happy to have her mom with her. Dee asked her mom where they were going on their travels.
“Let’s go to the park,” her mom said. 
Dee squealed with delight. She ran around and hugged her mom.
On the way to the park, Dee saw a brightly colored kite in the sky and said, “Look mom! A kite!”
“Yes, it’s beautiful!” her mom replied with a smile.
Finally they reached the park and Dee ran off to explore. She found a playground with a slide, a swing and a seesaw.
“Come on, Dee!” Her mom called out.
Dee smiled and went to her mom. Together they ran, laughed, and played until sunset. At the end of the day, both Dee and her mom were happy to have traveled to the park.

Once there was a wolf. He was very clean - he had just had a bath. He was so happy that he decided to go for a bounce! He jumped up high and waggled from side to side. He bounced really high and then low. He spun and jumped and bounced around until he was too tired.
As the wolf relaxed, he saw a butterfly. Its wings were so beautiful and colourful. He wanted to bounce with it. So he went over and said hello. The butterfly said hello back and then flew away. The wolf watched it go as he bounced and twirled behind it.
The wolf had so much fun bouncing around with the butterfly. He wished the fun would never end. But eventually he got too tired, so he had to go home. He carried on bouncing until he got home.
The wolf was so tired, but he was also happy. He was clean and had had a wonderful time bouncing with the butterfly. He snuggled down and tried to remember every second of his adventure. What a wonderful day!

Once upon a time, there was a jet. The jet wanted to go on an adventure. So, it sent out a message to the world. The message said, "Let's go on a journey!" 
The jet flew high into the sky. It was so cold. But the jet didn't mind. It kept flying and flying, until it saw a very beautiful place.
The jet was so excited. It sent a message back to the world saying, "We're here! It's so pretty!"
The jet stayed in this place for a while, enjoying the beautiful view. Then, when it was ready, it sent a goodbye message back down to the world and flew off on another adventure!

John and Milly were always up to mischief. One day, they asked their mum if they could have some cauliflower.
Mum smiled and said yes, so they ran to the supermarket to buy some cauliflower. But when they got there, she said that the cauliflower was too hard. 
John and Milly were disappointed, so they demanded that mum find them some soft cauliflower. 
Mum smiled and said she knew where to find the soft cauliflower. She took the children to a local farm, where they picked the softest cauliflower they had ever seen.
John and Milly were so excited! They waved goodbye to the farmer and ran home with their cauliflower, happy that they'd found the perfect treat.

Once upon a time there was a lady who had a big dream. She wanted to carry her dream far away and make it come true. Every day the lady tried hard to make it happen, but the dream seemed so far away.
One day a kind man saw the lady trying so hard. He went to her and said, "Do not feel ashamed, I will help you carry your dream". The lady was so thankful to the kind man and together they began to make the dream come true.
Soon, the dream came true and the lady was so happy. The kind man had helped her in a very important way and she will always be thankful for his help.
This story teaches us that we should never feel ashamed to ask for help. Sometimes, asking for help can make our dreams come true.

John walked into the children's room and saw a little boy sitting in the corner. He was feeling very ashamed. 
John said "Oh, hello! What's your name?". 
The little boy replied "My name is Jack." 
John asked "What's wrong, Jack?". 
Jack said "The other children were laughing at me. They said I'm too slow". 
John said "It's ok, Jack. Everyone can be slow sometimes. Do you know what I do to feel better when I'm feeling a bit ashamed?"
Jack said "No, what do you do?". 
John replied "I like to go for a run. It makes me feel better". 
Jack said "But I can't run as fast as the other kids. "
John said "That's ok. I'll hold the staff and you can run with me". 
Jack nodded and smiled. John and Jack held hands and began to run together around the playground. They laughed and smiled and soon they both felt better.

So Jimmy took out his big box of toys and started looking through it. He chose a fit blue car and a fit pink doll. He also found a fit red teddy bear, so he put it in his sack.
He wanted to see if he could fit any more toys in the sack. He tried ringing a fit jigsaw puzzle and a fit ball, but it was too full.
So Jimmy closed the sack and carried it around. He had made it fit all his toys, and he was so proud of his achievement.

Once upon a time, there were two brothers. The eldest brother was very good at trades, while the youngest brother liked to soak in the sun. Every day, the eldest brother would go out and make trades so that he could get nice things for his younger brother. To show his appreciation, the younger brother would also get up early in the morning and help his brother with his trades. 
On one such day, the two brothers went to a trading fair. There, they saw all sorts of nice things that they wanted. They spent the whole day trading and the elder brother managed to get some nice things for his younger brother.
When night came, the eldest brother asked his younger brother whether he was satisfied with the trades. The younger brother smiled and said that everything was just fine.
The following day, the younger brother asked his elder brother if he could go and soak in the sun for a bit. The elder brother smiled and said yes. As his younger brother ran off, the elder brother scratched his head and said aloud, "It's a good thing I made those trades yesterday." 
And, when the elder brother's younger brother came back, he brought the elder brother a fine gift. It was something that the elder brother had wanted at the trading fair the day before! 
The younger brother had gone to the trading fair and managed to make a trade on his own! The elder brother was so proud. From then on

One day, Jane wanted to make a special surprise for her mom. She went to the kitchen and counted out two cups of sugar and one cup of salt. She mixed them together and made a sweet, salty treat. She was so proud of herself that she ran to the living room to show her mom the surprise.
But when her mom saw the surprise, she was hurt. Jane had forgotten to add the most important ingredient, the number three. Without three cups of sugar, the salty treat was too salty and not sweet enough. 
Jane felt so sad, she didn't know what to do. Her mom hugged her tightly and told her that she could make it better by adding more sugar. Jane was so happy, she ran back to the kitchen and added another cup of sugar. This time, it was the perfect combination of sweet and salty. 
The next day, Jane and her mom shared the sweet, salty treat and smiled. Jane was so proud that she had made the perfect treat all by herself!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Suzy and she had a mommy and daddy. Today, Suzy was feeling very curious. She wanted to peek inside the kitchen and find out what kind of yummy treats mommy was baking.
So, Suzy sneakily tippy-toed over to the kitchen door and peeked around the corner. She saw some yummy cookies on the counter. Suddenly, her mommy heard Suzy and said, "Suzy, why are you peeking around the corner?"
Suzy felt a little bit guilty, so she looked down and said, "I just wanted to see what kind of yummy treats you were making for me." Mommy smiled and said, "Come here and sit on my shoulder so you can watch. But always remember not to peek at things that are not for you to look at."
Suzy was very happy and she'll always remember the lessons she learned that day. Peeking into other people's business can lead to unwanted trouble.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sarah. Sarah's mom always bought her books, and so they had to buy a bookcase to fit them all.
One day Sarah saw the bookcase and said, “Mommy, what is that?” Her mom replied, “That’s a bookcase. We put all of your books in it.” Sarah repeated the word, “Bookcase!”
Soon, Sarah was old enough to stand on a chair and look at the bookcase. But she found there was a book that she could not reach. She asked her mom to get it for her. But mom told her “No, you have to learn to be independent.” 
Sarah did not understand, so she asked, “What does it mean to be independent?” Her mom said, “It means not to be ignorant. It means to be brave and try to do things on your own.” 
Sarah looked around and realized that she could take a chair and use it to reach the book. She repeated her mom's words and shouted, “I can do it! I am independent!” And she did! She picked up the book and hugged it with joy. She had proven to herself and her mom that she was brave, independent, and not ignorant!

Once upon a time, there were two friends, Sally and Timmy. They were very jolly and often spent their days on the playground.
One day, Sally had an itch on her arm and started scratching. 'That looks really itchy,' said Timmy. 
They decided to discuss the itch and find a solution. 'Maybe you should put some cream on it?' Timmy suggested.
'Yes, good idea,' said Sally, nodding her head. She ran off to get the cream while Timmy waited. After a few minutes, Sally returned with a pot of cream and they applied it to the itch. 
The cream worked wonders and Sally's itch was quickly gone. 'That was a good idea, thank you,' she said, smiling at Timmy. 
They hugged each other, feeling very jolly. Together, they had found a solution to the itch and they were proud of their achievement. 
The story ends here, but Sally and Timmy continued to be friends and always had lots of jolly fun.

One day, a little girl went exploring in the jungle. She was wearing a big, long, green jungle hat. As she walked along, she heard a loud snap! The little girl was scared.
But then she saw a big black snake! The snake didn't see her, so the little girl was brave and picked up a stick. She waved the stick around, and the snake snapped away! The little girl was so excited!
The little girl kept exploring the black jungle and had lots of fun. She even made a few new friends! From then on, she went exploring in the jungle all the time. She was never afraid of the snapping snakes!

Max loved it so much that he asked the mouse if he could have more. The mouse said no and ran away. But Max didn't mind at all. His collar sparkled in the sun and he was happy. He was so happy he even began to sing. The end.

Jack was a brave little boy who loved to climb. Jack had to go to the park every week with his tutor. One day when he got there, he thought it looked like the perfect place to climb. He saw a big tree and asked his tutor if he could climb it.
His tutor said that it looked dangerous, so Jack had to think of something else. He saw a slide and said that he wanted to climb that instead. His tutor said that it was ok, so Jack ran to the slide.
Jack had so much fun climbing the slide that he almost forgot he was with his tutor. He made it all the way to the top and shouted with joy. His tutor then reminded him to be careful and not to do anything dangerous.
Jack agreed and made his way back down the slide. He ran off to play, still with a smile on his face from his fun climb!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Max. He wanted to go on a trip with his family, but he was very tired. So he stayed home alone.
He looked out the window to see everyone already off on their trip. He felt sad that he wasn't part of the family fun. Suddenly he heard a loud noise coming from the backyard.
He went outside to investigate. To his surprise, he saw the family’s old tree rotting away. Max was so disappointed. He decided that he needed to do something. 
He decided to take a nap to try and forget about the rotted tree. He thought maybe he could think of a way to make things right when he woke up. 
When Max woke up a few hours later, he found that the tree had completely rotted away. There was nothing Max could do. He felt so sad that he was away while this happened. He wished he had been there to prevent it from rotting. Then he sadly realized that he was too tired to help.
 
The end.

Once upon a time, a little girl called Anna loved the beach. She would dream of the amazing sand and the calming blue sea. 
One day, Anna asked her mum if they could go to the beach and she said yes. So off they went to the beach, with bags full of toys and snacks. 
Anna was so excited when she saw the beach and all the amazing shells. She started spending her day building sandcastles and playing with her toys. 
Suddenly, it started to rain. Anna was worried and so was her mum. They gathered all the toys, grabbed their bags and ran quickly to the car. 
But as they got close, Anna saw a most amazing sight. The rain had made all of the sand sparkle and shimmer. As a special treat, her mum said they could stay and watch. 
So Anna stayed, bouncing up and down in amazement. After a while, the rain stopped and the wonderful beach shone. Anna had a most amazing day.

Once there was an elderly man who was very tired. One day he decided to take a nap in the yard. He lay down in the grass under the big tree on the west side of the yard.
A curious three year old girl and her little brother had been playing in the yard. When they saw the man, they ran over to him.
"Mister, why are you taking a nap?" asked the little girl.
The elderly man smiled at them. "I'm very tired, so I'm taking a nap," he said.
The little girl's brother pulled on her arm and said, "Come on, let's take a nap too!"
The girl giggled. "OK," she said, and she lay down next to the man in the grass.
The elderly man smiled, watching the little girl and her brother snuggle close and fall asleep. After a while, he dozed off too.

As he kept playing, the sky grew darker and the colors around him changed. He watched as the sun slowly disappeared and darkness spread over the sky. But just before the sun was gone, Charlie saw the most beautiful sight- a yellow sunset! 
He was mesmerized. He had never seen something so beautiful before. In that moment, he knew he would always remember the brilliant yellow sunset. 
He smiled from ear to ear and kept playing as the sky grew darker and darker. Even as the night came, he stayed there in the backyard playing with his truck. When it was time to go to bed, he snuggled in his bed and fell asleep with a special memory of the magical yellow sunset.

Jess' mom said "Jess, you have done such a good job! You have been very polite and you have hung up all of the clothes very carefully. You did a great job!"

Once, there were two friends, Marley and Alex, who loved to play together. One day, they decided to play with Marley's toy boat in the pond. 
The boat had a thick hull, so they were sure it wouldn't leak. But as they sailed the boat around the pond, they noticed water started to quickly fill it up! 
Marley: "Alex! The boat is leaking!"
Alex: "We gotta find a way to stop the leak!" 
 
They started to think up ideas. Marley suggested using a patch to cover the leak. Alex hopped back to his house to grab one. 
When Alex returned to the pond, he applied the patch to the hull. The thick patch was the perfect size and stopped the leak! 
They were so relieved and excited to continue playing with the boat. They had learned save the day, and also had lots of fun!

Once there was a little girl named Amy. Every morning her mother used to give her a special case to take with her to school. In it was a healthy snack, an extra dress and a special toy.
One day, when Amy was getting ready for school, her mother said: "Amy, please don't forget to take your case with you."
Amy replied: "I know mummy, I always take it."
At school, the teacher asked the children to share their snacks with the other children. When it was Amy's turn, she looked into the case and saw that it was almost empty. She had eaten all the snacks without thinking about sharing them.
Amy was ashamed of her behaviour, so she politely said to the teacher: "I'm sorry, I didn't bring a snack for the other children."
The teacher hugged Amy and said: "It's ok, but from now on, you should always share with others, it's not regular to keep everything for yourself." 
Amy was happy that her teacher taught her such an important lesson: always share with others!

Once upon a time, there was a hairy pup. It was so small that it could fit in one hand. Every day, the pup grew bigger and bigger. Soon, it was just as big as the curtain from the window. 
The pup liked playing with the curtain. He would wrestle it and climb around it. Nothing was as much fun as the curtain.
One day, the pup was running around the room and suddenly, he got tangled up in the curtain. He couldn't free himself, so he started barking for help. His mom heard him and quickly came to the rescue. She freed him from the curtain.
After that, the pup kept his distance from the curtain. He liked playing around it, but he knew enough to stay away from it now. He was happy that he was a little smarter!

Once upon a time, there were two friends named Susy and Joe. They were best friends, and did everything together. One day, they decided to go to the beach. They had a lot of fun. The sun was shining, and the sand felt warm.
The two friends found a big shell. It was very shiny, and it was the perfect shape. Susy and Joe both thought it was the most wonderful thing they had ever seen. They both wanted the shell, and they started to argue.
Susy started to yell. "I saw it first! It's mine!", she shouted. Joe was angry. He started to yell too. "No! I saw it first! It's mine!", he shouted. 
Suddenly a third person appeared. He was very popular around the beach. He had a kind smile. He quietly said "I think it would be nice if you two shared the shell. That way, you could both be happy."
But Susy and Joe didn't listen. They just kept yelling and arguing. The popular man sadly shook his head and walked away. 
Susy and Joe never got to keep the shell. In the end, neither one was happy.

There was a woman, named Joanne, who loved to teach people. Every day, she would go to the park and teach the children who went there. One day, a little boy came to the park and didn't know very much about the world around him. He was very ignorant. 
Joanne saw this and asked the little boy what he wanted to learn. He looked up at Joanne with his big, innocent eyes and said he wanted to learn about everything. 
Joanne smiled and said, "Let me teach you then." She began to show him the park and taught him about the plants and the birds. She explained to him the importance of being kind to the people and animals around him. 
By the end of the day, the little boy was not ignorant anymore. He thanked Joanne for teaching him and said he was going to be kind to everyone in the park. Joanne was proud of the little boy and smiled. 
The moral of the story is that teaching someone is a great way to make a difference. Everyone needs to be taught something in order to gain knowledge. Teaching someone not only helps them learn, but also opens up their eyes to the world around them.

The friends did not know how to get across, but after a while they came up with a plan. They made a raft and set sail for the other side.
They worked together and soon the tricky crossing was completed. The friends were so proud of themselves for overcoming the difficult journey.
They finally reached the other side, and the adventure could continue!

Once upon a time, there were two friends called Amy and Ben. 
Amy was a little girl and was three years old. Ben was an orange crane. 
One day, Amy and Ben decided to go on an adventure. 
So they started to march towards the forest. The sun was shining and they were happy.
Suddenly, it started to rain. Amy and Ben were getting wet!
They stopped and looked around. 
Amy said to Ben: "What do we do now?". 
Ben replied, "Let's march a bit further. I think I can see a dry spot over there."
And so Amy and Ben marched again. The rain finally stopped and they eventually made it to the dry spot. 
Amy and Ben had lots of fun and enjoyed their adventure. They were happy to have made it to the dry spot!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy called Max. Max wanted to go on an adventure. He put on his shoes and coat and went outside. He started to walk along the path that led out of the village. 
As he walked, he came across a farm. There were so many animals there! He could see horses, cows and sheep. The farm was so big and the animals were so cute!
Max wanted to go and pet one of the animals, but he was scared. He thought he might scare them away. So he just kept walking around the farm. Then, suddenly he noticed a sweet smell. It was coming from a little barn next to the farm.
Max went into the barn and saw a pile of hay. When he touched it, it was so soft! Then he heard something moving inside. It was a small, white, fluffy kitten!
Max kneeled down and said hello to the kitten. The kitten replied in a sweet voice. They talked for a bit and then the little kitten asked Max to come back again another day.
Max said goodbye to the kitten and left the little barn. As he started to walk home he thought to himself, "Farms can be so much fun!"

Once upon a time, there was a very huge bear. He had a lot of fur all over his body. In the summer, the bear was very warm, so he decided to remove some of his fur.
He scratched and scratched until all of his fur was gone, leaving him feeling very cold.
The bear jumped up and down to try and stay warm, but nothing worked. He started to shiver and shake until he felt very cold.
Then, he got a bright idea. He decided to ask his friends for help. He asked the rabbits to give him some of their fur to keep him warm.
The rabbits were so kind that they gave him all of their fur. The bear was so happy and he put it all on. Finally, he was warm and could go on to have a nice day.

One day, Ted was playing in the garden with his toy car. Suddenly, he heard a loud noise. It was coming from inside his house. Ted was scared, so he ran inside to hide. 
He opened the freezer door and crept inside. It was cold, but he felt safe. When the noise stopped, Ted came out of the freezer and looked around. 
He noticed the dangerous smoke coming from the kitchen. His mom was in there, trying to put out a fire. She yelled out, “Ted, stay away! It’s too dangerous!” 
Ted stayed back and watched, but he wanted to help. Then he had an idea. He got a bucket of water and put out the fire. His mom smiled and said, “Thank you for protecting us.” 
From that moment on, Ted knew that he could always protect those he loved. He was brave and strong.

Alice and Bob were walking in the park.
Alice said, "Let's go to the office".
Bob replied, "OK".
When they arrived, the office was empty. Alice put her hand into her sack, and took out a key. She used the key to open the door, and they both went inside.
Bob looked around and said, "It's so empty in here".
Alice smiled and said, "Let's make it better".
Bob looked in his sack and took out some crayons and paper. Alice got out a teddy bear and started drawing on the paper.
They both laughed and made the office look much better.

Once upon a time there was a happy dog named Bob. Bob loved the dark because that was when he could do all his fun games. 
One night Bob went into the dark, but he forgot something very important - to listen!  He stumbled around quietly, hoping not to wake anyone up.
Suddenly he heard a small voice. It said, “Hello there! Who are you?” Bob was so surprised! It was a little mouse peeking out from a crack in the wall.  
The mouse said, “Why don't you come and play with me in the dark? I can show you all sorts of fun things.” Bob was really excited and said yes! He followed the mouse and they began to play. 
Bob and the mouse had so much fun in the dark together. Through the night they laughed and played together until it was time to go home. Bob thanked the mouse and smiled a happy goodbye.

Once upon a time, there lived a little dog called Pippy. Pippy lived with her best friend, a little girl named Jenna. Jenna loved to dress Pippy up in all sorts of silly costumes. Pippy always felt silly but she loved spending time with Jenna, so she put up with it. 
One day Jenna decided to put Pippy in a special Halloween costume. It had a big pumpkin head on it. Poor Pippy felt so stupid but she still followed Jenna around the park. 
Suddenly Jenna stopped and pointed to a big skeleton. Jenna said, "Look! That's a scary skeleton! I bet it's not very nice!" 
That's when Pippy noticed the skeleton was holding a big juicy bone. Pippy got so excited she forgot how silly she looked and ran over to the skeleton. She decided to try and chew the bone away from the skeleton. 
The skeleton was held together by magic and it wiggled back and forth trying to get away. Pippy chewed and chewed and eventually the bone came free! Jenna and Pippy laughed and ran off with the bone. 
They made it all the way back to the park before Pippy looked down at her costume and remembered how stupid she looked. But Jenna just smiled and said, "That's ok Pippy! You were brave and that's all that matters."
